intro: Psychotria martiana, commonly known as the "Amazonian ghostplant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its striking dark purple to black berries, which are highly poisonous to humans and animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Its unique appearance and toxic properties make it a notable yet dangerous species in its ecosystem.
